clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment With Nutritional Eating Plan and Dietary Fibers in Adult Patients With HIV/AIDS
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Treatment Nutritional With Supplementation About Biochemical Profile and Anthropometry in Adult Patients With HIV/AIDS

lead_sponsor.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

clinical_study.source: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate if nutritional treatment with nutritional supplementation of dietary fiber reduces cholesterol levels and triglycerides (dyslipidemia) in patients with HIV/AIDS receiving antiretroviral therapy (HAART).

primary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in total cholesterol, triglycerides, HDL-C and LDL-C.

secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in fasting blood glucose.

Assessment of the presence of gastrointestinal symptoms (nausea and/or vomiting, dyspepsia, heartburn, diarrhea, flatulence and constipation), associated or not with antiretrorival therapy, before and after intervention to verify their effectiveness in reducing these symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence to the nutritional intervention and nutritional appointments
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of dietary intake modification after intervention and patient's return to nutritional appointments.
Changes from baseline in total body fat percentage, percentage of fat in the trunk, percentage of fat in the arms, percentage of fat in the legs and lean body mass percentage.
Changes from baseline in weight, waist circumference, abdominal circumference, waist-to-hip ratio and Body Mass Index (BMI).

arm_group.description: Symbiotic (dietary fibers + probiotic bacteria) 6g sachet twice daily for 6 months, dietary prescription and nutritional counseling
Maltodextrin (placebo for symbiotic) 6g sachet twice daily for 6 months, dietary intervention and nutritional counseling.

intervention.description: 6g sachet composition: Lactobacillus paracasei, Lactobacillus rhamnosus, Lactobacillus acidophillus, Bifidobacterium lactis and fructooligosaccharides. Each patient was instructed to consume two sachets per day, one in the morning and another before bedtime, diluted in 100 ml of filtered or boiled water at room temperature. The dietary supplement should be taken every day for 6 months.

6g sachet of maltodextrin, a complex carbohydrate. Each patient was instructed to consume two sachets per day, one in the morning and another before bedtime, diluted in 100 ml of filtered or boiled water at room temperature. Placebo should be taken daily for 6 months.

Nutritional intervention consists of dietary prescription (nutritional eating plan) for healthy eating based on the Dietary Guidelines for the Brazilian Population and Clinical Manual on Food and Nutrition in HIV-infected Adults Care, both Brazil Ministry of Health guidelines, in addition to nutritional counseling for preexistent clinical conditions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-infected patients
- Adults (≥ 19 years old)
- On highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Breastfeeding
- Opportunistic disease
